oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Camel Rock & Roll Dance Party - 1956-05-12 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: CBS Rock 'N' Roll Dance Party program sponsored by Camel cigarettes, 1956-05-12 part 2. Hosted by Alan Freed with announcer Roy Rowan, starring Count Basie and his Orchestra with vocalist Joe Williams, and special guest stars the Robins, and Kitty White. Produced and directed by Lou Melamed.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Count Basie Orchestra; Kitty White; Joe Williams; Robins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: April In Paris (Count Basie Orchestra) [continued from part 1] -- Alan Freed introduces Kitty White -- I'm Gonna Be A Fool Next Monday (Kitty White) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial (Alan Freed) -- Alan Freed introduces Joe Williams -- Stop, Pretty Baby (Joe Williams, Count Basie Orchestra) -- Alan Freed introduces the Robins -- One Kiss (Robins) (recording) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial (Alan Freed) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Alan Freed talks -- Jumpin' At The Woodside (Count Basie Orchestra) -- Closing statement (Alan Freed) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Roy Rowan) -- Station announcements -- Weather report (incomplete) -- When You're Smiling (unidentified performer)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: CBS Inc.; R.J. Reynolds Tobacco Company; Camel rock 'n roll dance party (Radio program); Freed, Alan; Rowan, Roy; Basie, Count, 1904-1984; Count Basie Orchestra; Williams, Joe, 1918-1999; Payne, Sonny, 1926-1979; Robins (Musical group); White, Kitty; Melamed, Louis
